clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Effect of the Supine Position at Brain Velocities in Noncerebro - Injured Patient

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the pulsatility index changes after setting supine position in non brain- injured patient under general anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation the pulsatility index after setting prone position in non brain-injured patient

arm_group.arm_group_label: pulsatility index mesured with doppler ultrasound

study_pop.textblock:
Patient who need a surgery in supine position and who don't have brain injured or pulmonary desease.
Forty patients over 24 month period were included in the study, after informed consent.
Pulsatility index is mesured with doppler ultrasound:
1. before general anesthesia
2. after general anesthesia in dorsal position
3. in supine position
4. in supine position with 15° proclive Evaluation to the pulsatility index changes in theese position

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- minimum 18 years old, maximum 45 years old for men and 55 years old for women.
- surgery with supine position.
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to participate
- failure of measurement brain velocity
- Penthotal or de kétamine before measurment
- Cardiac or pulmonary desease
